DeHEQrHK53y81WJvJZrp3w.text: Customer service is horrid.  Asked for a booth when we walked in.  None was available but requested to be moved from bar when one became available.  When one did before our food was delivered, we were COLDLY told it was not possible.  Really!  Not again will we step foot at this place.  There are other ramen places around town!  Update after the meal:  The food was not delicious at all.  We had shoyu ramen and fried rice.  The noodles were cheap and the fries rice was greasy.

tZlpHiSCG5Ngmt1IBBjS8g.text: My venture today started out with a recommendation from a foodie. So when I arrived they immediately approached us with seating options, I actually used the restroom which are astonishingly clean. Tables get cleaned and prepped quick. The fried rice was amazing, and the Black Garlic Ramen will bring me back for another visit. Beyond that our service was Five Star, very attentive, with great recommendations and ultra instinct beverage refills. Can't wait to visit again!

A7HXeJX3khRFxjb14yKOAw.text: I am Vegan so I ordered the Vegetarian Ramen as is, just no egg.  It was ok.  I just think the broth could've been better.  It tasted like plain vegetable broth from a carton.  And the tempura veggies in it got soggy right away so it just tasted like wet, soggy, breaded veggies in my ramen.  I did have leftovers, so I ended up adding to it to make the broth taste yummier!  Besides the ramen, we did order the Tempura with veggies only!  That was good.  We also ordered the Shishito Peppers.  We didn't know until it came out that it had Fish Flakes.  I had to ask what it was when it arrived and then requested another without.   They were good!  Also, I noticed they had slippery floors while on my way to the bathroom.  They have polished marble tiles, which made it riskier to walk on while greasy.  Be careful folks!  Altogether, I'd probably go back if it was somebody else's idea.  But I still think Jinya is better!

XNoFji7iwDb9t2y_D43v5Q.text: Update: I've been about 5 times since my first review (it's the closest ramen place to my house). And the food has been consistently good. Not the best I've ever had, but always tasty.  My most recent trip was pick up. I ordered extra soup and when I got home I realized the entire bowl had spilled out. First thought maybe the lid wasn't on correctly but looking closer I found a small cut on the bottom of the bowl.. super disappointed.   Original review: 5stars for food. The ramen was very good! Kevin was my server and he was super nice.  Why 3 stars? It was just me so I sat at the bar to avoid a wait and there were two things: Every time the door opened the air would come in and it's freezing, so I'm sure it'll be hot in the summer..  Second the bar stools were SOOOOOO uncomfortable! Seriously, horrible. I sat down and there was no stability at all. It took me 2 mins to "kinda" get situated. Then tried again by getting up and pulling he chair in, it was a disaster. Then the ladies sitting next to me commented that they had he same issue. Then a party of 2 girls came in and one was like "omg, I'm gunna fall." THEN a guy sat directly next to me and did he exact same thing I did, trying to adjust his seat a million times. Even while I was eating it just didn't feel right.

DhpEdR-3O4MMSy3fcGUIkQ.text: Ramen?!?  Did someone mention RAMEN?!?  While in town visiting my daughter, I spotted a new ramen place near the Centennial Walmart, so I wasted no time and made a beeline for their door, dragging my daughter behind me. Unfortunately, the wait time was more than 45 mins the first time we tried, so we ventured back after lunch hours another day.  SCORE!  No line and we were seated immediately.  Our waitress dropped off menus and took our drink orders.  My daughter has celiac disease, so when we inquired about the gluten content of some of their items, she was kind enough to chat with the chef to ensure a selection that would meet her needs.  Unfortunately, this restaurant is NOT gluten friendly and has an extremely limited number of items that are gluten free.  She opted for the spicy tuna roll and edamame.  I chose the original Tonkotsu Ramen (spicy).  We also ordered crispy rice with tuna to start.  Our edamame was delivered first.  The shells were solidly green and impeccable fresh.  They had been perfectly steamed (no excess water drenching the pods) and sprinkled with coarse salt.  Our crispy rice was delivered as we munched on our edamame.  Mildly spicy tuna sat atop rice squares that had been fried until crispy, and then each piece was topped with a jalapeno slice.  Normally the dish is drizzled with eel sauce and chipotle mayo, but we asked to have the sauce on the side so my daughter could enjoy it.  Very nice dish, and the rice was perfectly chewy.  My ramen and my daughter's sushi roll was delivered shortly after we finished our appetizers.  My ramen was steaming hot and colored with a light orange hue indicating they had, indeed, added the spice I'd requested.  The broth was flavorful,  as were the accompaniments (Pork, soft boiled egg, veggies).  Was it the best ramen I've ever tried?  No.  Was it good?  Yes.  Would I return? You bet!  Good prices and good service guarantee I'll stop by next time I'm in town, because after 46 years in Vegas, you can take the girl out of Vegas, but you can't take Vegas out of the girl!  I'll be back!

F1LG4TElp2DW4ZLMRdkIVg.text: This place was quick and delicious! I'm a huge ramen fan (no pho over here!) so finding this place near my new neighborhood was a great find. I had the spicy black garlic which was very good, I can't wait to try all of the other flavors too. The prices were good too, very close to eating a fast food meal.

qADXUNLsM_bxumdruhMMQA.text: Ichi Ramen serves varies type of Ramen. They offer Curry Ramen, Tomato Seafood Ramen, and etc. They have several appetizers such as Takoyaki.   You can get a meal set with any type of Ramen and a side dish. The Crunch California Roll and Takoyaki were delicious. My dad enjoyed the Takoyaki, even though he's not a fan of seafood.   I ordered the Black Garlic Ramen, it had a lot of garlic and the noodles were thin. The noodles were nice and chewy with the broth.  I heard some of my friends love this place, and one of my friend says the ramen is salty.  The place is moderately small compare to the other ramen shops. It was a nice experience visiting Ichi Ramen. I wouldn't mind going again. They were playing K-pop songs, some bringing back memories from my high school days~

k4YLDrWzl6Nl-fvtx_VKFg.text: A great ramen spot for the area! The food and service are great.  We arrived for an early dinner and only had a short wait for a table, but the line definitely grew as we dined. The dining room has less than a dozen tables and bar style seating as well. Take-out appeared to be a large part of their business as well.  To start the meal we shared Gyoza, Edamame, and Crispy Rice with Tuna. The Gyoza was tender with a nicely flavored filling. Edamame was soft and had the right amount of salt topping. The Crispy Rice with Tuna had more sauces than usually on this type of dish, but overall was good. It probably would have been better without so much sauce though.  My main entree was the Creamy Tonkotsu Ramen. This was delicious, especially the broth. I loved every individual ingredient as well as the overall flavor. The pork slices were thin which made it much easier to eat. My friend ordered the Classic Tonkotsu Ramen which I tasted and I loved the broth on this one as well.I really didn't have a favorite between the two because they were both great. The spice for both was served on the side so spice level could be added at the table. My friend did the combination option which added a salad and the gyoza to his meal. The salad dressing for his salad was amazing. It tasted like a great combination of ginger and garlic.  Our service was attentive and no time was wasted getting our orders in. The pricing was the real standout here. For two of us to have ramen and starters we left for around $40. I thought for sure that they forgot to charge me for something when I saw the total. Nope, the pricing really is that great.

apiM6jyGyfUy_O82jJ-ogg.text: This ramen is absolutely delicious!! I have a cold and this is so delicious and helping me feel somewhat normal!! The broth is so perfect then you add the spice in there! The pork is absolutely amazing and melts in your mouth. The spicy tuna roll was delicious!

ht4CUFivEnrSWRryGbureg.text: This place has amazing ramen and one of the top locations to go in northwest vegas. Theres not many options in the 89131 zip code. Make sure to get a half hour early there during the lunch hours. It tends to get busy.

jrrxnSSpoR-oCnOCDl9D6g.text: I live about 1.5 miles from this place and never knew it was here! b_fejqr4XnJDHVdRYLJUYw.text: My partner and I usually (98% of the time) get the crunch roll as our appetizer, and every time it's delicious. We've been here enough times to where we have tried every ramen in the menu except the tomato seafood and the vegetarian ramen, and let me just say from the ones I have tried I have a hard time deciding which one to have because they are that good. Yes sometimes it's busy and you have to wait but it's a small place and for me it's worth the wait, longest we waited was about 30 minutes. Love this place!

I8kareVo0W__tcTZHj0Jfw.text: Tonight, I tried Ichi for the third time...it will be my last.  I was trying to be open minded and try different dishes to see if it would pick up...but tonight was the biggest fail.  Creamy tonkatsu is lacking in flavor...additions were sparse...chashu was thin and flavorless.  The broth was bland.  I tried the chicken broth my last visit and that was a bit better than the miso tonkatsu and creamy tonkatsu.  Overall, overpriced for bland flavor and unfulfilling meals.  You're better off going to Ramen Tatsu, Monta or others in the Chinatown area.

yLdC-3FReyjTtgOdhBQ_tA.text: Consistent quality food and service. Just a little small so you have to beat the crowds.

VXEk7rTOYMxCQF0PCcPJ2g.text: I love love love this place.  They always have good customer service and good food.   The ramen is out of this world especially on a cold winters day.  I like this place because it's always clean and they really keep the menu simple but serve everything with a ton of flavor.   You definitely get your money's worth.   Everything is reasonably priced and I've never had a bad experience at this restaurant.   Some employees are nicer then others so I would make sure they all are giving you excellent "in and out " burger style customer service.

STPmcRX99E_rxcuGk8it2A.text: Glad that there's a ramen joint on the Northwest side of town. My favorite is the spicy creamy tonkotsu ramen! W13W77QOMfQMPFQZvtZ0Tg.text: The service was prompt and polite.  The restaurant is very clean.  The food is good but a commercial version of ramen. Exs-_Y1Ma64KFVIZWjysGw.text: There may be a wait to have a seat at this ramen spot, but it's worth the wait. The black garlic ramen is a must. fTTSs78pxWgozeAatQI1cw.text: Love this place. Chicken ramen is very good. Sushi rolls are all delicious. This place is now a weekly favorite.

uhNvUiNqYOLt7ipP-7TC0g.text: Never had anything like it.  I thought it was soup. The employee explained to me how the food was made and I ordered the chicken ramen to take home.  I have to say it was absolutely delicious. I will be back to try another dish soon.  Really loved my order.  The staff very knowledgeable and super friendly.  Thank you Ichi for a whole new food experience

lvSMiafOQ3Kfq_FUZJ6ZbQ.text: It's okay. I've had a lot better ramen in Vegas. They got my order wrong. I tried the curry ramen. I'm gonna come back and try the black garlic ramen I heard it's the best. Service was average.

mtte9ULL-B7aWBraBnlRTQ.text: Went there today and it was the best Ramen we've ever had.  We got the Spicy Shoyu Ramen and Spicy Chicken Ramen.  We also got the fried rice, stuffed jalepeno bomb and gyoza.  We've has some of the best Ramen (Saimin) in Hawaii and this place was better than anyplace we've been in Hawaii.  Everything was so flavorful!  We had Kevin as our server and he was very friendly, informed and fast.  The entire staff was friendly.  We will definitely go back.  Reasonable prices, too!

KDY0YWYl1e2IzktsJlblBg.text: Stopped in for some ramen today with my cousins and was pleasantly satisfied! I'm from LA so naturally I'm used to crappy service with long faces, sub-par food and expensive prices. We came in and it was jam packed but we got our name on the list and were taken care of by Kevin and our actual waiter Keenan. Keenan was super nice and kept up with our sass and sarcasm all while waiting on us attentively. He definitely didn't fall into that monotony of a typical waiter. Both super sweet guys! The ramen was good but Keenan made this review 5 stars!

8lKu2zTvI5QV6IGmfspOzQ.text: Da bomb!!! Had the black garlic ramen and combo'd it with salad and a spicy tuna roll. Salad was great but the roll wasn't fresh tasting. Otherwise it would have been 5 stars.

FqgHKyRfHVvORFFD6us0mg.text: Been waiting to try this place for awhile first time at a ramen restaurant tried the seafood with garlic sauce disappointed the fish had hardly no flavor and the meal itself wasn't very good maybe it's just me because people must like it they were really busy

gjG3bGwC7Nx5-IfGiQBeaA.text: Ramen is great here. The service is friendly and efficient. The price is reasonable. If some other small dishes could be improved, I will offer 5 stars for sure.

b24KgQOpkjjg8QbXm3EjRA.text: I wanted a good Ramen noodle place near the house and this place delivered quality and service to the full extent. Great food, great service, great atmosphere... I'll definitely be back again soon!

_89O_la_ChZmSExZH1WodA.text: Very very busy but I got there to pick up food for my customer looks really good I wanna go back to eat there one time but don't take my review for it go and try it cause I will come back and eat there some day oh make sure you eat there a week day cause this place can get really busy like I said in the beginning lol

cD-erWcu_aXRSl4jgeGOsA.text: For just being Ramen with added stuff it's really good I can eat ramen for days their Sushi isn't so bad either

4YG3hrN-hPD-082221-q_Q.text: Food was good! Plenty of selections! Service was great, but for being popular there is not much sitting. So on off hours I would recommend! Their wasabi vinaigrette is awesome!

iF35tDbx7awWKXS69AbJAg.text: This is a new ramen place in centennial center. So we've tried this place twice, once for to go and once in the restaurant. So the to-go classic tonkatsu ramen spicy was impressive, broth was piping hot 4 slices of chashu and plenty of green onions and sprouts. So impressed we said hey let's go there and I bet it will be so good.  Next day... I order a ramen spicy combination plate comes with a side salad, and your choice of goyza, varieties of sushi or fried rice. I ordered a classic tonkatsu ramen with extra green onion (extra charge) and a spicy tuna roll.  Sushi roll comes out. Very good portion. Then the ramen came in to play. 2 small slices of chasu....The broth was warm It was not hot at all. Which was odd too me, so I let it pass. Broth was tasty and spicy. The green onion was barely there :(. Noodles are a little too thick in my opinion but good and half a plain boiled egg. Half way thru the meal I was thinking did I order this correctly because I didn't receive our side salad, then I asked and our waiter said oh yeah you ordered the combo. I rather get the food Togo if that's where I'm gonna get the quality. I'm still going to visit here and hope that they work out the kinks and hope that I came on a bad night.

EvR6LQISKGlPB1Xdvf99Ug.text: This place is fantastic. I have had their curry ramen several times and it never disappoints. I just wish this place was a little bigger.

qQHC7z94Lk0o8ZaU-2KW3g.text: I am glad to have tried The Ramen House. The food was good, but not amazing. The service was good  #beentheredonethat

ilXzrI_GJgRCo1k3a_Inbg.text: I love this place! I've come a few times with some friends. It's affordable and filling. My only complaint is that the normal soup (without adding any 'heat' to it), is just a little bland for my taste. Otherwise, the staff is SUPER sweet; constantly checking up on you, asking if you need anything, and even just communicating with the customers and making them feel even more comfortable. This place does get busy, but it's totally worth it! Can not wait to come back again!

DoXSXfEMzSXipTjnUsZv_w.text: The tonkotsu is really good and its comparable to the ramen that I've had back when I lived in Japan. The takoyaki was so good I got 2 orders of it. Would definitely come back and bring family and friends.

qGqPJ_Wj37Mze2bcL8x0Gg.text: Food was good and tonkatsu was very tasty. A bit salty, but perhaps that's why it tasted so good! The egg was a bit over done.  Awesome staff and interior of the place was beautifully done. Watch out for the flooring tho because it was slippery when we went. As a designer, I liked it but a honed tile will be safer for customers in my opinion. I'll come back again. Glad to see a Ramen house open in NW.

7QRn5oRdEaVAgw-xq_SVsQ.text: We went here because we live nearby and they have great reviews.  I don't know what those other people ate but the chicken ramen we had was quite possibly the worst food I've ever had in a restaurant.  Specifically, the soup base was so salty that after one or two spoonsful I couldn't take it any more.  Since I'd paid good money for this, I felt I should at least eat the solid stuff.  After a bottle and a half of water to wash it down, I finished the solid stuff and then went home and drank some orange juice to get the salt taste out of my mouth.  Speaking of the solid stuff, what my $8.95 bought was two slices of chicken breast 1/8" thick, half a boiled egg and some noodles.  They must get about six bowls of soup out of each chicken breast.  With so little content, even if this soup had been delicious, I would have been better off to go to Teriyaki Madness nearby for a MUCH better value.  Better yet, I could have gone to about any Vietnamese place for a bowl of pho that wouldn't give me high blood pressure from all the salt.

bIrLw_7pQD8oKxBbiXi1Gg.text: There food is amazing!  My eight year old said he thinks he liked it more than In N Out which is saying a lot since he's only 8.  He doesn't even eat "soup"!!! I tried to give it 4.5 stars but apparently I'm inept.  The only reason I docked them is because the service was a tad slow.  However, he later explained they just opened a week ago and were not prepared for the volume they were receiving.  Totally understandable, and we are so happy they are doing well already and that we have a dope ramen joint in the NW.  We had the Takoyaki (soooo good) Chicken Karaage, Shoyu Ramen and I had the Black Garlic.  I can't decide which was better honestly.  The quality was worth the wait, the ambiance was perfect.  The place was a little small and they had a long line but worth the wait.  Due to the wait, I don't suggest going there starving.  However, we left SUPER full and SUPER satisfied!!!  Can't wait to go back.  Keep up the good work!  Prices are reasonable as well!!!

W_ecr3yHdfS4Pcc50KIdtQ.text: Found this place after shopping at Walmart. Decided to go in for a quick lunch with my daughter and surprisingly it was packed. The young hostess was very nice and informed us it was going to be about 20 minutes or less to get seated. The wait ended up being 10 minutes. When I sat down I was greeted immediately by the server, who happened to be the hostess as well! Talk about multi-tasking! Anyways, ordered drinks and placed my order after she came back with our drinks. I ordered the Black Garlic Ramen for me and for my daughter, the chicken karaage. Food came out quick. The Black Garlic Ramen was amazing! The garlic chips and garlic oil they put in, really gives it that awesome kick ass flavor. My daughter also enjoyed her chicken karaage. The karaage was perfect for her. A bit on the small size, but for a kid it was perfect. Not only was the food great and met me and my daughter's expectations, service was also great! Kudos to the girl that was hosting, serving, and bussing, she was kicking ass! I will definitely be back to try the rest of their ramen!

ky0c5a3r71nRkRYXQ5bFnQ.text: My usual place for ramen is Kabuki but seeing as I was on my lunch break for work I didn't have time to drive there. I'd been researching Ichi ramen for about a week before actually coming in reviews were decent enough. So I came in on lunch break and was instantly greeted in Japanese I might add(I just love restaurants that do that idk why lol) my waiter was very friendly terribly sorry I can't remember his name for the life of me. Anyways he was friendly and very knowledgeable and helped me decided which ramen to get. I ordered the spicy miso ramen with extra chasu. It was made and brought out to me a lot quicker than I expected. As soon as I took the first bite I fell in love! Most places I've been to the miso ramen is super salty! But ichi was just the right amount of salt I must've inhaled that bowl in less that 5 minutes it was so good. I love that they gave me a bottle of chilled filtered water to drink on the side as well as what I ordered to drink nice touch. Not a lot of places in Vegas have good water. It's also very inexpensive after all was said and done I spent about $13. End consensus I will be returning on my breaks to try out there other styles of ramen and some sushi. Arigato Ichi Ramen!

XEVO1IGSLPS1bd1vkRUZyw.text: GREAT!!! The wait was about 20 minutes but it was worth it!! Ive never had ramen before but I'm glad to have went there for my first time! Incredibly delicious and filling! The mochi ice cream at the end was PERFECT!

YUMBwY8dhCD8GKXT5x0NFw.text: This is my favorite ramen in all of the Vegas Valley, and I'm so lucky I live 15 minutes from here! The quality is pretty consistent. The broth is not too salty or heavy. The people that work here seem like they're always in a good mood when I dine-in. My only gripe is the serving is smaller than other ramen places I've been to.

photos.caption: Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EgUJaYmbHue0IyI_YS5Qow.text: I took my son here this afternoon for a late lunch and was surprised at how busy the place was. They were fully staffed and we were quickly seated, and our waiter too our drink order right away. Another server brought us waters over with a cute bottle that was only half emptied when we filled our glasses, which was a nice touch. We quickly decided what we wanted, orderin an appetizer of Agadashi (deep fried tofu) and then a California Roll & Chashu Fried Rice for my son and a Curry Ramen bowl for myself.  They were very accommodating to my changing my ramen order, substituting fried tofu for the katsu pork. The food was fantastic, and came out quickly. The servers kept checking back asking if we needed anything, and clearing the table in a very timely fashion. If there was any complaint, it was that the soda my son ordered was in a can and over priced for that, and that my hot tea was a Lipton Green Tea Bag just dropped in a cup. No hot water refills, no soda refills.  Given that I'd still give this place a 9 out of 10!

photos.caption: Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian Curry Ramen with fried tofu and broccoli.
Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Agadashi
Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chashu Fried Rice and a California Roll.

CuGO2d0EugoXOT-p8CMhIA.text: Manager is very rude. My family and I walked in at 8 pm before the rush it was relatively empty. We had a party of 10. Upon walking in an employee told us that we could all be seated at the bar and have the whole bar bench to ourselves. She sat us down, put out menus, napkins, straws and glasses of water (10 sets mind you). Then more people start to come in, the manager tells them to sign in on a list of some sort (a list which we were not informed we had to sign). Then the manager says that everyone else has to be seated and served before we can be served even though we were there FIRST and ALREADY SEATED. We tried to tell the manager this and he didn't care and told us to leave our seats and wait OUTSIDE. I politely asked for the general managers number (as this was unacceptable) to which he very very rudely replied "I am the manager, this is my number, you can call me right now if you'd like" very sarcastic and rude to a customer with a party of 10 that would have brought you lots of money for the night. Just think 10 dollars per bowl, 10 customers, not including appetizers and or sides it's easily already 100+ dollars not including a tip that we would leave. So to be treated this way in such a rude manner with no regard for customer needs or satisfaction is ridiculous. Especially since it was a manager that was so rude to us (the rest of the staff was nice and understanding). Would like a general managers number or something for this issue to be resolved. Will be emailing the company until this is resolved in a reasonable manner.

4ECt0mH7ap95qsq1IY_7zA.text: My daughter and I went and had dinner here this evening. The ramen is delicious, the staff is friendly and they had our food out in a timely manner. I would HIGHLY recommend this place. It's great to be able to eat Ramen in my local neighborhood without having to drive to Spring Mountain. We will definitely be going back. The only recommendation I would have is for them to expand because the place is small and seems to be very popular already.

w2fEE-9UmcA-dO_P-btKbg.text: I always get the vegetarian ramen here and it is delicious! The broth has great flavor and the tempura vegetables give it a nice crunch. I highly recommend this place.

xBmTwA4RzH3AcF4NnZaS6A.text: I was excited to see a Ramen place in the northwest. I heard that it was good and always saw a line to get in. Very disappointed with the ramen. The pork is not tender and the pieces of pork were so small. There are hardly any onions or bamboo shoots. It is not authentic at all. I went back a second time to give it another try but again disappointed. We will drive the 45 min to Chinatown for our Ramen.

shFepAcFWEK9LPaTIOGU8g.text: This place is great. I had the veggie ramen and it was incredible. I would definitely recommend this to my friends.

ilyDdN6s5fW6DU4YZbES0w.text: I usually don't eat at ramen restaurants because of past experience at other restaurants but I was pleased with Ichi Ramen. I did like the taste and portion size of my miso ramen. I did feel like the size of the crunch roll is smaller then other places. I will most likely return.

yckIoQPP28QJdGS2lCqF3w.text: Lets start with the food, I had the combination meal with the black garlic ramen. The presentation of the black garlic ramen was great and the black garlic sauce was tasty but i would like mine alittle more garlicy.  the cali roll was a cali roll..  The overall decor was nice inside except for the floor can be washed more often. Still is a great option for japanese ramen. Will be back to try the others

4-aXUHTetsk9YB_V7QhmCQ.text: This place was okay. I really wanted ramen but did not want to drive all the way down to china town. Upon arrival, the restaurant was fairly spaced, we were seated immediately as we didn't mind sitting at the bar. The ramen itself was okay, however, I was not a fan of the slimy texture of the noodles and the super salty broth. On the plus side, the fried rice was really good! Can't say i like it enough to come back though. If you like Monta, its worth the drive to china town.

xuI_zfRMPEmQ_GZ2pIT0YA.text: First time visit and we were impressed. Everything was fresh and served in a timely manner. I do wish they offered more drink options, but the food was delicious. Can't wait to go back and try another entree.

LippauDpS1Eahhtm4td5cQ.text: Great Ramen! I will for sure have this again.  Had the garlic ramen and fried rice. Very interested in trying all the different combinations.

W5D0HnMlpf4fgLpP5AS5_Q.text: The reviews for Ichi were all over the place, but the hubs and I decided to give them a chance and I'm super glad we did! There was a short wait but it was  no big deal. Kevin was our server and he was incredibly pleasant, kind, and attentive. He did an awesome job. We started with some edamame & gyoza which were delicious. I got the creamy tonkotsu ramen and my husband went with the curry ramen. Mine was delicious...that soft boiled egg is to die for, man. My husband said the curry ramen was good but that next time he'll kick the spicy ness up a little bit. We skipped dessert this time, but we'll definitely be back. Stoked to have a ramen place in our 'hood finally! I want to try the sushi next time, and I'll definitely report back!

1uQfrgLk1vSXkdUm_qqwrA.text: The service was quick and polite and the food was great. I am not a huge curry fam but I tried the Curry Ramen and it was amazing. The prices were really fair and inexpensive. I wanted to order more! The soft-shelled crab was good and we tried the sushi which was less then $5 but tasted great. I would definitely go again!

pfa-FDH9M2WjGfgcvX89CA.text: Great service and delicious food at a reasonable price!  Everyone is friendly at this establishment.  If you go at the wrong time, you may have to wait a while as it's not a very big place. However, it is definitely worth the wait. And if you have a big appetite, just ask for an additional side of the meat in your soup. It's one of our favorite go to!!

8o0J-hlw9YhZdPJFa_gryg.text: I really like this place. Service was quick, everything came put perfectly, the seating was great and the environment was bustling.

ct0sc7QgMUgiY12h-h4VHQ.text: Very good food! I highly recommend eating here. I am not a fan of soup and I thoroughly enjoyed the ramen here!

4d5gFGQjlmsTbIT6hmICdw.text: We were pretty excited for a Ramen restaurant in the Centennial area but left slightly disappointed. We came in  a little after the dinner rush and the place was still fairly packed. Waters came quickly but we had to wave someone down to take our order after sitting there with the menus closed for 10 minutes. The server had said he'd be right back to take orders when he brought out the water.  Service: Poor, pretty much non existent after taking our initial order. No check ups or anything after waiting over 30 minutes for the food to come out. My water cup was empty and they did not bring water until after the food arrived. I could've used a refill during the lull. The servers don't have specific sections so we were receiving overlapping service.  Food: Ordered the Agedashi Tofu and it was bad. Instead of the traditional thin layer of crispy starch, it was deep fried in tempura batter. The ramen Miso and Garlic Oil ramen were decently portioned for the price. I like that they include half an egg and spice for no additional charge. The egg however, is not seasoned and just plain boiled.   Overall: Truly it deserves two stars but I'll be nice since they are brand new and still going through growing pains. We're still thankful for a Ramen shop near home and will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Agedashi Tofu&#34; Not really, just tempura fried tofu. Do not recommend
Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plain boiled egg, not seasoned like traditional ramen

IdaEfbKeqliENqv2mRQycw.text: Really nice to have a Ramen joint next to home. Before Ichi we would drive 20 minutes or so just for a bowl of buttery delicious broth. I especially like the curry ramen at ichi. And their kimchi fried rice is good.

WtrCRm-48QrX4PuR4YCglg.text: Yummy! We love this place. Always good food, good casual atmosphere and we love the variety of options. The staff could be a little better in regard to attentiveness and customer service, but they're definitely not the worst either.

OHNxjOpTkUooM_IbIORcRg.text: Outstanding! Went for the 1st time today. Ramen is delicious and service great. We'll be back!

e4ISUEoafyGaJwQbHLX3WQ.text: Came at noon on a Sunday and waited about 10 min not bad compared to what it looked like last night - we chose not to wait.  Pros - nice service and decor             Flavorful chicken ramen and super hot (temp)             They do serve limited beer              Decent menu options   Cons- a bit pricey for the amount of soup you get and only 2 super small pieces of chicken.              My daughter thought there should be a wider selection of ramen options   Not a bad little spot. I'm excited to have it in the northwest.

photos.caption: Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eQTFjMPh77XyzLJqwp_n4A.text: This place is very busy but it is worth it. Full of flavor and filling. Food was out 5 min after we ordered and tasted amazing. Just wish there was a little more veggies and meat with my meal but otherwise amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy black was amazing. Full of flavor

ZiXfMnl9LeLvmfTBIumBWg.text: We once went to the restaurant but the wait was to long, so decided to try delivery. Was very good for delivery. Arrived in 30 minutes after expected in 45-55. Great Ramen and (sinus) spicy as I ordered. Big portion of Ramen, nice that the broth and noodles came separate, no mushy noodles, nice touch! Were considering Chinese then were so happy we went Ichi. Takeout Sushi is not to be expected but was fresh, a little small however but worth it good clean. The pot stickers were good. Brussels sprouts could of used a little salt but were not greasy and all in all very good. The fried rice would be the only change, just bland but maybe the type ordered. Will order again, for sure. Thank You Ichi Ramen House and Grub Hub for the very fast delivery! B++ rating for the $60 price tag and portions. (Again the Ramen was plenty big). Happy this time around!

F3aFS3XIQTTJiZLY-zgsKQ.text: Really disappointed. Ordered delivery through Grubhub. Super skimpy on the broth. Didn't send hot sauce when requested spicy ramen.

88Dc-CfJsa1zeGhjSzBQ1g.text: I wish I could give half stars because they are definitely closer to a 3.5 than they are to a 3.  Anytime I review a Ramen place I always use Monta as my frame of reference. They're seriously the king of Ramen in Vegas. This place is so close to home & i've been meaning to try it for that reason. I would appreciate not having to drive all the way to Spring Mountain in order to get my Ramen fix. The menu is pretty extensive they have more options for standard bowls than Monta. The add-ons are also less expensive. In order to get an egg you will only pay one dollar (versus $1.50 at Monta). Not to mention in most of the bowls you actually already receive your first egg and corn included. WIN ON THAT FRONT!! The broth is solid. The add ins are tasty. The only reason they don't win a four or five? The NOODLES. That is after all the whole point of the trip. These noodles are more reminiscent of the packaged ones, than of most Ramen places. Don't get me wrong. They're thick, less likely to get soggy but they're definitely not the quality being used at other places. You can tell that by just looking at the way the noodle has that little Ramen curl.  Another downside for me is that they don't have chili oil or minced garlic. I've come to appreciate those little perks because they pair nicely as a dipping sauce for GYOZA!  All in all, I'll definitely be back, but for Ramen... my overall recommendation is still the king. Monta.

fS23SOghTt34-uJ-GfZrsA.text: Ordered togo today. I know they just opened so I'm going to give them a chance to get a hang of things. I ordered creamy tonkotsu ramen & tempura veggies/shrimp. It was super packed & they didn't  get to me for awhile. I already ordered in advance on the phone, but they did not get my name or number. This caused confusion with other orders and they had to ask other people what their orders were. After picking up, I noticed the soup spilled all over the bag & my car. The soup container had holes in it! :( Thankfully there was some left to eat. The ramen and broth were very good, BUT it was missing the corn which was listed to be part of the creamy tonkostu ramen. :( Corn is one of my favorite additions to ramen so that was upsetting. I will be back for sure since the food is good. They'll probably tighten up soon.   ** Update 10/16/17  Ate in the restaurant this time. Good service & great food! We went near closing time so no long waits or anything. Definitely our new go to! All ramen restaurants seem to be small. Not sure if it's supposed to be part of the ramen house experience or what? lol Wish it was bigger. Will be back for sure. Love how it's right down the street from me.

vq2935uHbog_kOMhjQoNNw.text: Its really good the appetizers are ok if you want to get a good appetizer I recommend the gyoza and I recommend the tomato and seafood ramen its healthy and delicious and the staff are very friendly and kind and get your drinks and food in about 15 to 20 minutes so its really goo I really recommend it if you want to go out with friends or fsmily

n_7foP9AU9afZCTOcahePw.text: I didn't know here was a ramen spot in the North! Love there are many options for broth and spicy levels. The garlic broth is my favorite! You can also turn your meal into a combo by adding $5 for a side salad, sushi roll, etc. I'll definitely be coming back!

Uc_IDAsKJtZrWQP51-i8gQ.text: Good ramen for a good price. I did the ramen combo where you get ramen, salad, and a additional side and was completely satisfied. Well worth the long wait.

pVXWtwn93K-AY80BXTPzJA.text: For this place being the only ramen in the NW, it's good. Not my fave. But I'm just so happy we have a place up here for ramen. Can't comment in service as I got my order to go, but I got the miso ramen. Broth was good, noodles were alright, not the best, but overall a good place to get your noodle fix if you don't want to go to Chinatown. We had their rolls as well, and it's no Nobu sushi, but pairs well with the ramen. Will be back for sure.

El2QDbufBGhwFtZxLnIinA.text: This place is ok. It's nice to have a ramen house up in the NW but if you've been to a ramen house like Jinya or Monta this place just can't compete.

goliAl9fOT3z8LZpwugzLA.text: Lovin their sushi. But my fave is ramen. Everything here is fresh. I am very very picky about ramen. I've been to Seattle, San Francisco, Hawaii and try their very own ramen, i should say, this is one of my fave!

EvW93EEla8UpOqOiltPEjQ.text: Trying to like this place but the ramen isn't as good as the first few times I went here I slowed down because quality has gone down . Asked for mayo on said of soft shell crab got everything on the side so the stuff I like I got less and I got three things of mayo wtf. We got the combination deals with ramen salad and app but they brought everything so scattered it was a joke . Then at the end we had to wait for a pen so we could sign the check and leave

kJ0v_CXyH4c9qxb8jNIxpw.text: It wasn't bad. It was okay. The service is really great. The food tasted bland in my opinion but my boyfriend was really impressed by their black garlic ramen.  I've had ramen in different states and restaurants and idk I just wasn't impressed. Felt like the seaweed salad wasn't fresh. The gyoza was okay but perfectly crispy. We'll probably be back in the future to try again.

z5rIFDrw5JBYZJnINcN3cg.text: A good ramen place in the area. We ordered the tonkatsu and shoyu for the adults and the chicken ramen for the littles. My son has 2 servings and he can be a little picky. The tonkatsu was my favorite, but the shoyu wasn't bad either. I would give it another try. Thanks Ichi!

vmee7L7uxoES_z3ks3OHSg.text: Classic tonkatsu ramen was excellent! Broth was spot on and chashu was delicious! Great service.

V3rXG6cRWOknFCKvMqaM1g.text: Good food but HORRIBLE service. Took so long we actually had to walk out which I never do. It was a Friday night so I get it's busy but 45 minutes after ordering and still no food is ridiculous for a place with maybe 10 tables.

MHcAdvCP0oM2Dy08dyAnSA.text: There aren't many great Asian restaurants on the north side of town, especially if you're looking for Ramen. I've been wanting to try this place for some time, and I'm glad I finally did. I had the black garlic ramen and it was delicious. It had a generous portion of noodles and the broth was not too salty. My only complaint it that it was a little light on chashu. We were seated immediately when arriving, which was around 1700 on a Thursday. It got really busy about an hour later and people were waiting in line. Give this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black garlic ramen with the family. Very good.

dlXV9GO99RP1K0cgywNSKQ.text: I actually enjoy this place for the fact that its on this side of town for when you don't want to make the trek to Chinatown.   I stumbled on this because I was sick and was really wanting some soup. There's usually a wait but for ramen it is always worth it.   My only thing that I didn't like is their karaage looked like popcorn chicken and just seemed like fried batter and no chicken at all. But the takoyaki is always my go to anyways.

photos.caption: Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What&#39;s supposed to be karaage but more like Popcorn chicken.

zOq5J62Zj-j7_8c6nwRjRA.text: A good ramen place to have in a pinch.  The taste is consistent over multiple visits and the service is ok.  Limited seating is available and we didn't feel comfortable sitting around chatting when people were 10 feet away were waiting.  Otherwise, we like coming back and trying out the different broths and combo options.

cfEuscq5iFyfOYsHoKXkGQ.text: I can confidently say that this is the best ramen place I have been to! I tried the black garlic ramen combination with a crunch roll. The perfect amount of noodle to soup ratio and such a great deal to add on a roll to your ramen + a small house salad. I recommend all my friends to come try this place out!

4pcfsxadkQrb7QjsQlaBYA.text: Over rated. Expensive top ramen and extremely salty. I just ate it and I'm sitting here feeling like My blood pressure just shot through the roof. It's not horrible but I wouldn't eat it again.

CmVQlFbQrY68Zcui9qrMhA.text: Came to this place as a last resort when another ramen noodle restaurant was too busy. It seems to have a decent wait time around 10 - 15 minutes. Once we were seated a waitress took our drink order and informed us there was no kid options. She did mention how we could make our noodle order kid friendly which was chicken broth with noodles. The waiter that took our order seemed to be in a rush - didn't offer to explain to us the mild chicken ramen had the sauce on the side and apparently didn't take our order right - because when we did receive our order it was incorrect.  They were able to remake our order in a timely fashion. However the only thing we all agreed to enjoy was the appetizer - spicy tuna Jalapenos which unfortunately enough only came in an order of two pieces.  Was a place to try - wouldn't return or recommend.

EX4ndsk0Uaz3SF3K4IFbpw.text: The service was great.  The sushi was wonderful but the shrimp fried rice while it had great flavor, it has salad shrimp and so it's not deveined and unfortunately I found a long strand of hair in my rice. I get things happen.  I may go back in the future.

iyjP1FjwRG3wnvNMyFYulw.text: Visited at about 4:30 on Tuesday and things could not have gone better.  The place was about 1/3 full, so we were seated right away in a booth.  The waitress was very friendly and took our order promptly.  We had the gyoza as an appetizer and it was excellent.  We then had the Chicken Ramen (mild), the Tomato Seafood Ramen (extra spicy), and the Chashu Fried Rice.  All items were delicious and the service was excellent.  I highly recommend this place for ramen!

HxzR8KlVtkQRe_V7BtfikQ.text: Well I'm giving this 4 bc the ramen was good but they ran out of my friend's choice of food, then they said had no lemons & I ordered Gyoza and it took forever I had to go ask them ask the other waiter twice for them. I was starving or else I wouldn't have ordered them as an "app"-that should be before my meal comes. Anyway it's a small size bowl it was hearty w noodles but only got two tiny pieces of chicken. You have to pay extra $ for chicken or more noodles. The gyoza I got was a bit soggy but at that point I didn't wana mention it bc I didn't have time to wait for another order. I got regular chicken and it's pretty bland tasting so u May wana get the spicy red sauce on the side. It's a very small restaurant only about 8 Ian seats on the side/bar counter area and maybe 6 booths. Apparently I are supposed to write your name down for waiting lists the girl next to us said no one told her. I hope they start telling people so they don't get into arguments regarding who was there first. Otherwise I'd go back but it's pretty far out of my are(20+ min from Summerlin) so I'll go if we are already in the area. Hopefully the service will be more prompt and they won't forget my food lol. Wish they had lemons bc tap water is pretty blah without it lol. Decent prices -$8.95 for ramen bowl or they've got combos. I'm used to Cali prices @$6 For a bowl but it's doable. We will go back and check it out again.

D6IkQg0SawLNRbOk7jHhXw.text: 3.75*** really. Cozy place. Packed for dinner. You can't just have a bottle of sake without ordering something. It's not a bar! There is bar-type seating, but meant for single diners facing a wall.   Too bad the sun sets with its warmth beaming into their entrance. Summertime blues - it was pretty toasty inside. Ramen cravers... look forward to sweaty nose beads while slurping up your ramen.  Their crunch roll was satisfying. I should've stuck to that, and maybe ordered another. I didn't think their ramen was great. Two things I enjoyed: soup broth and the soft egg. Otherwise, I'll go back to my fave ramen spot on Jones.  Have the black bottle sake super chilled!

photos.caption: Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crunch roll nommzzzzz! I&#39;d like more please.

Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creamy tonkatsu

-4bgyZqQx4AlSRKx0SBWeA.text: Not only is this place my favorite ramen joint in town, it's basically all of my friends's favorite as well.  Take your pick from the menu and you will like it.  If you don't, I'd be genuinely surprised.  This is why I can't pick a favorite.  The only reason I don't come here more often is because I live on the complete opposite side of town and it take a good 30 minutes to get here.  Otherwise, I'd come here every cheat day.(It doesn't hurt that there's a Vegan Cinnamon Roll place next door as well for something like that)  Stop thinking about coming here, just do it.

RygND4E9cNHniLJ5HSiBwQ.text: Very disappointing experience given ramen is one of my favorite foods. I arrived just 15 minutes after opening, expecting to beat the lunch rush but it still took awhile to get my food.   I ordered a shoyu ramen. It was underwhelming. The broth was tepid, not nearly hot enough to cook the raw sprouts. The egg had a nice soft yolk but the egg white had no flavor, so it probably wasn't marinated long enough. The noodles came to me in a clump. I'm guessing they were in a rush and didn't cook it long enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Ichi Ramen House - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clumpy noodles

D6jjaacjiJxIJcORJ4VNug.text: Got take out tonight. First time here. I got mild miso ramen combo w/salad and spicy tuna roll-all delish!  My husband got chicken ramen, he liked a lot, also a combo w/salad and pot stickers but the pot stickers were bland. I look forward to going back and trying more items while eating in house.

oOF9meAG2fCyOZsbFfo2ug.text: Its alright, its a very clean place and the staffs are ok. But the taste of the food, isnt what i was expecting! But i'll come here when im close by.

fMJG820AhSRzkQDoSTfBbQ.text: Went to Ichi Ramen last night with my fiance.  All I can say is the food was very boring.  Raman soup was almost flavorless, not at all what I expected.

AXD7mr8zRIo7Y0om8pRfUg.text: Japanese curry made without beef! Yes! Very flavorful. Chicken fried rice was good flavored but a touch dry.  Gyoza was yummy and not greasy like so many other places.  You get a carafe of water which is great because you don't have to wait for a refill.  Very good prices.  Chicken karaage comes in tiny morsels instead of a large piece so this could be good for kids too. I will be making this a regular destination.   Caveat: they have few tables and they're very popular so you must be prepared to wait. But the service is lightning fast once you're seated.

hUL04JefcoWK6XNML_LG4w.text: UGH Ichi ramen was my GO TO after hangovers or when craving ramen while I lived in centennial. I absolutely love their miso ramen.  I find myself even craving it randomly at times. They're fast and never disappoint me. I've never eaten inside but my take out is quick.

F71CNATlOzfdxxwZVyGm5g.text: Love that we have a sweet little ramen house in the northwest! Their appetizers fulfill my need for a little sushi while their big bowls of hot noodles comfort my soul. On a cold rainy day like today this restaurant hits the spot. The service is always fast and efficient. Drinks are promptly refilled and a big bottle of water is set at the table for easy access. I just tried their new fried soft shell crab and it was delicious! The lightly breaded crunchy sweet crab sits on a bed of carrot puree. As far as ramen goes, I love the black garlic ramen. It's well rounded flavor is heightened by the bits of black garlic. It has an egg and chasu along with some crunchy veggies. The noodles are thin and not over cooked. The only negative is that it gets packed! You may have to wait a while for a seat if you go during dinner time but their takeout is just as good!

KkSjdkVyL0B0eqqJ18pLQA.text: Been here around 10 times and haven't had a bad meal yet.  It's a tiny place which I like and gets busy rather quickly.  Great ramen bowls and be sure to try the fried rice. It's excellent too.

jrD-CwVqeBYK4CWnJ6YCVg.text: I really liked this place. I did have a to go order but the restaurant looked nice and comfortable. I was really impressed with the food. I had the Tomato Seafood Ramen and it was delicious and had great flavor. My only wish would be for there to be more scallops. I only had a half of one and it was a small one.  Fair amount of shrimp(they are very small though) and clams.  My sister had the chicken ramen and she really liked hers too. We also got the tempora brussel sprouts but they were very hard and I have dentures and couldn't eat them. . I will definitely be back  This is the second time I have ordered from ichi through grubhub that my order has been messed up. One time they completely forgot an item which was my sisters dinner. That was not grubhubs fault that was ichi's fault. Right now I have waited over an hour for an order and I live 3 minutes from ichi!!!!!!!    I will never order with Grubhub again.  But Ichi's food can't be beat.

3DAhE64RUdqBntC2NNUXwQ.text: Excellent food, service and what wonderful flavors. I had the curry ramen bowl and spiced it up and WOW highly recommended. We will be back for more.

vHdqnGG5HSfYfoTmaetKbA.text: Love this place!! My girlfriend brought me here with much hesitation on my part I've been back several times and keep trying to bring others. I've tried 4 different bowls so far and love them all. Jalapeno bombs and octopus balls are awesome too

k9f_1haPlEjZTI48j2WnGQ.text: Great Customer service! Food was good and fast too. Only con is that the floor is a little slippery.

ul__AHzdVv5S231HTZHMTQ.text: What an awesome find! Just as delicious as any Ramen place down on Spring Mountain! My new go to.

H_5fFEE20avGCyb6SotR4w.text: First things first, thank god we have ramen up north now!  Ok so as far as this place goes. I had a really good experience. Went in last night during peek hours, so I was subject to a 20min wait but it's a relatively small place and they were PACKED.   Walking in the place was very lively and I was greeted with some Japanese saying that I believe means help or welcome. Good music playing and the interior was pretty cool.  Atmosphere - 5 stars  I ordered the classic tonkatsu and chatshu fried rice. The fried rice was good and very flavorful. The tonkatsu was reallllyyy good. It's one of the best I've had. Deep flavors, good portion, good temperature. Overall really good Food - 5 stars  Service was decent. Not terrible but I've had better. They were very busy so I'm giving them a little slack. I was taken care of but just wasn't impressed with that part.  Services - 4 stars  Overall - 5 stars and recommend this place to everyone to try at least once!

b8Wmc71iPFrZ3x5V5L0j9Q.text: I was excited that there was going to be a ramen house on the northwest side of town. I saw all the positive reviews and had to try it out, but I was very underwhelmed. There are not many choices to pick from in the menu and the ramen was just okay. The restaurant is very cramped and you sit uncomfortably close to other customers. The waiting area is just a tiny corner at the front of the restaurant. The only thing I liked was the service. It's unlikely that I'll return. I guess I will have to go across town to get my ramen fix.

fwbbnwdov65gjbfw3ks2IQ.text: I've been back a few times and I'm hooked. The miso is my new fav. and the black garlic was my fav. before. We are actually working our way down the menu. So far no complaints on anything we have ordered.

J8cc5HPzyH_YXtBGocrV2w.text: So I've have eaten here twice since it opened a couple of weeks ago the first time I thought the Ramen was pretty good the broth had good flavor the fried octopus balls were also pretty good, however today the Ramen broth could have been salty dish water it was hard to tell. Having worked in F&B  for the last 25 years it's hard to sit down in a restaurants and give an unbiased opinion on any amount of money that I am spending for a meal good or bad. This is also the only place for Ramen in a 10 mile radius so we will keep coming back for now. Also I noticed the "Owners" sitting at the back table counting their money I thought that was very tacky get an office.

6Jv3yKJ4g31-lPMnBHvGZg.text: I've now been to Ichi three times. The food is excellent and the atmosphere is great. My only complaint is after the food is dropped off, you never get a follow up visit from the server. This has consistently been the case. I'll be back, but please train be staff to be more attentive to the guests needs and maybe anticipate placing the check on the table or refilling water jugs.

V-GdsNv_QfzLQ6BwBXGOjA.text: I'm so happy there is finally an awesome Ramen house near us! The ramen was fantastic, the place was packed, but they ran everything quickly and without issues. The atmosphere here is modern cozy. Great casual date night, but still family friendly.

KRUsTFpZizQDPU5lUutScg.text: The restaurant was clean and nice inside.  The service was good, however,  the ramen was ok.  The noodles were over cooked from a package.  Portion size was small for the price.  My 10 year old son that's barely 65 lbs was able to finish his reg size miso ramen and part of his appetizer.    There was nothing special about the soup base except there wasn't enough that came with the meal.  You have an option to purchase more soup which I think is a scam.  Since the noodles were overcooked and there was little soup, it seemed like a noodle stew instead of ramen.  I wasn't impressed.   I would rather drive the distance from centennial to Spring Mountain than eat there.

5bH5z7M-tk0Bqz_A7652Nw.text: I live in the Northwest and would travel to Chinatown to get my ramen fix, but I am happy to say that I was thrilled to see that Ichi Ramen was opening up here. I went last week and was pleasantly surprised to find that their food was every bit as good as the ramen joints down on the strip area. If you live up in the northwest, and you like ramen, do yourself a favor and check out Ichi Ramen.

Td7e418qUgeT7HsDAu48JA.text: Words cannot even describe how amazing this place is! I order the classic ramen and it is simply delicious and the presentation is beautifully executed. The staff is very friendly, they are very patient and explain the different menu items to you and the prices are extremely reasonable too. This is the gem of the NW!!!

3GOOZxwhBoTomnns_gt77Q.text: Spicy Chicken Ramen yummy  very flavorful. Glad I found a new spot for ramen! Very clean place, great service and food was fresh.

y4F67Dw2scYBhEc6CZUy_w.text: I came and tried this place out! I don't have any issues with the food! We actually liked it! The issue in which I think it can be improved ere the SERVICE, SERVERS PERSONALITY and ATTENTIVENESS! and also Music is Too Loud!

tZGxV2SAeoqTneYZ8-WaCQ.text: Love the spicy miso ramen extra noodles.They play kpop which my daughter loves, staff is super friendly.

b9eJGhW0f4hvFUgxM7hNjg.text: One of our local favorites! The miso ramen is delicious. Shrimp tempura a very good too. One of the better Ramen houses in town.

cwDuAiKDb3FSIQoXT3Wb6w.text: We have been waiting forever to have a ramen place at this end of Las Vegas!  I was a little afraid we'd have to settle for mediocre, but Ichi Ramen House is on par with our favorite places in Chinatown!    We had the Miso Ramen, Black Garlic Ramen, and deep fried Brussels sprouts.  Everything was absolutely delicious!  The miso broth is probably the best I've ever had.  Yummmmmmmm!  It's not a big place, but if you're a ramen fan, you're used to that.  We'll be back.....a lot!

r6WJ0PFROrFmZ4IXSblnkQ.text: This is one of the places I go on a regular, it's in Centennial Hills and I actually went today but I was a half hour early, they don't open till 11:30  The place is small, sometimes there is a short wait...all the seating is booth style, I recommend getting the combination, for 5 bucks more you get a sushi roll (BOMB), several choices to pick from...The Black Garlic Ramen is to die for, I might of made moaning noises and embarrassed the family.. You are looking at about 8.95 at the most for a bowl, it's an AMAZING deal and the food is on point!!  Most of the soups are pork based, they do have a chicken and a veggie soup  The staff is very accommodating, younger staff that is really fun, good music and very clean...if you go let me know how you liked it..   MY RATING IS 5 STAR!!!

TOOPa1WJzGh4YOtifawc2A.text: I love how this place is close by my work and I do love me a good ramen place. This place was nice inside, they have a few booths and a few tables you can make together for a bigger party. I've realized though that all ramen places are small..   They have all the classic ramens, which my favorite is the tonkatsu ramen. You can make it spicy or not spicy. Up to you! The broth was good, it didn't feel like it was overly salty. It didn't feel like I had the taste of fat in my mouth.. I've noticed that sometimes if the broth can be filled with too much fat on the top. I don't like it when my mouth has that taste in my mouth, this ramen didn't give me that mouth feeling. Which is good. Ha! It was just enough ramen for me. They have some deals on the menu that you can buy the ramen and also get a side of california roll or gyoza along with a side salad. They have a few other options too!  When I'm needing my quick ramen fix, I will be back :)

aiJfxo7JWKwFeSJLo4w3Kg.text: Good Ramen house, though a bit small. After a 15 min. wait we were seated at a booth. Large parties might get a table or might have to sit at bar.   Started with edamame, which was the usual salty suck and snack.   Ordered the Black Garlic Ramen, which came out pretty quickly. Very very heavy on the garlic, but I'm ok with that.   I also ordered some Pork Katsu to add to my Ramen, but they burned the hell out of it, so I sent it back.   We also tried the Miso Ramen which was great, good flavor without being overbearing. Noodles for both were great.   Service was good, very friendly staff.   Note: I mixed the Black Garlic Ramen before I took the photo, it's prettier than that.

8BUeaeql2SZH2y-D301msg.text: 5/9 2nd Visit Update: I had a crazy ramen craving and couldn't get to Chinatown, so I gave this place another shot to redeem my impression last time. Well- my stars aren't changing... (brrr). I was very hungry and ordered the black garlic ramen based on other reviews here and their "chicken" karaage. I quote "chicken" because I surmise there MAY have been a scrap or two of flesh somewhere in the small pile of over-fried, greasy, thick, unsalted, tasteless clumps. They were crisp and then as you got to the center oil flavor just kept coming. I even bit experimentally into 1-2 of the larger pieces looking for meat, and only saw thick, oil-soaked batter. Got queasy. Decided to move on to the soup, which incidentally, they served to me a good 5 minutes before the appetizer, with no utensils (someone else, not my waiter, noticed I was sitting there with a bowl of hot ramen and no chopsticks and did bring a pair over with an embarrassed chuckle). First thing- the entire surface of the broth was encased in oil. I've had delicious, deeply flavorsome black garlic ramen at other places in town and it's always garlic oil DROPS floating on the surface, with fried garlic slices. This was a veritable layer of oil on top and the fried garlic and shallots? onions? in the broth were exceedingly bitter. The brother had decent flavor but tasted weak, like it was watered down. As I was sitting at the bar trying to eat, my neighbor to the right, a lady, kept exclaiming to her dining partner that her broth was "so salty, way too salty, yes, too salty for my taste" and finally pushed it away. My final disappointment was the noodles. They weren't the same as the ramen noodles served last time, which was the one redeeming quality of the horrible seafood ramen I ordered last visit and a point of positivity that I was looking forward to. They were white, and looked and felt like thinner rice noodles, definitely over boiled with none of the fresh bounce and chew and yellow color that I noticed last time. All in all, to say I regret spending $18 here (yes, I tipped the waiter $2 though he never checked on me once after he took my order) is an understatement and I definitely won't be back. Save your money for gas and drive to Chinatown- Ramen Sora, Monta, or even Sapporo Revolving Sushi which unexpectedly has the best black garlic broth I have tasted recently.  ............  This was literally one of the worst meals I have had in a while. I should've re-evaluated my choice to order the tomato broth seafood ramen when most Ramen places are known for their Tonkatsu, but I wanted to have something a little lighter for lunch. I also ordered their tempura appetizer which was a shrimp/ veggie combo. So... the ramen. It came looking like a jumble of noodles and vague ingredients in a liquid that smelled and looked very startlingly like Campbell's tomatoes soup. Not nicely laid out with ingredients on top, and I could see chunks of raw onion, which was not listed on the ingredients. I poked into it, and a sweet-tomato-seafood smell wafted up. I don't know what I was expecting, but the sweet, super salty, almost ketchupy taste was not it. The ingredients were spare, but I just couldn't get over the broth. To make things worth, I had ordered extra broth like I usually do and I was completely enveloped in this sweet salty tomato soup smell. The tempura didn't fare any better- no light crispy batter here, it was heavily battered, almost like a thick beer batter, and the shrimp were tiny- the vegetables a joke (one of them was a heavily battered single green bean) and to add insult to injury, the tempura sauce was super salty as well. My 2 stars are only for the cleanliness, decent service, and texture of the noodles, which were decently springy and chewy even being the thin style of ramen noodleGiven we don't have ramen options at all in the north, in sheer desperation I may come back to try the regular tonkatsu broth / meat options, but take my word for it- steer clear of the seafood option and the tempura!

s4z3A9TbwUJWJPCnPZCxQw.text: This restaurant is a good restaurant. If you are looking for really good ramen noodles, this isn't the place. They have okay noodles, but not the best. Their sushi is much better than anything else. The atmosphere is very nice. I expected something a lot more different.

uVUBBZf9x3bZnswVvrEoAQ.text: Came here twice just to see them in their busy vs slow time. It was an average ramen house.  During the busy weekend evening the wait time was about 30 min. Was surprised they don't really have a system to let you know when your wait time is over. There's a list you place your name on and wait to be called. Unfortunately it's so small there's no way everyone can wait there inside (it's January so it's too cold outside), but if you go wait in the car they don't take your phone number and there no buzzer so you'll just have to keep checking back.   As far as the food goes I ordered the traditional ramen combo. Pricing was great, as were the portions and the service. The salad and appetizer were average and unfortunately so was the ramen. The killer....the broth. It was watery and not very flavorful and I mean lets be real ramen without broth is just noodles.   If you live in the NW aliante and centennial areas as I do your options are pretty much this or Moko if you want ramen and don't want to go to Chinatown. I however might have to start making the drive.  Sidenote-watch the cleanliness of the glass water container they place at your table.

kEqIqO93KDU-ZPlcFiHpJQ.text: Having just returned to the states from a visit to Osaka, Japan my husband and I wanted some ramen. We both ordered the Tonkotsu with a side of gyoza and were happy to find it just as amazing as the ramen we had in Japan. I've seen some reviews about other ramen houses in town being "better" (I've been to them). Trust me, Ichi is authentic Japanese ramen.  I've been back several times and have ordered it for take away. Always great service & food.  Gochisosama.

-sqwtIMxnLotS9soXL9y0A.text: Lunch was wonderful.  Had the seafood ramen.   The staff was very accommodating.  I can't wait to go back.

_Kh-Zs_Vbpw7yg2ZB-6j8w.text: This is my second time coming here, and I loved it! I chose the chicken ramen, and omg their broth is so flavorful and yummy!  My first visit here was way different, then my second time. They've improved a lot and there wasn't a long wait for the food. I recommend to anyone who loves RAMEN and who lives around north! I'm so glad we have finally have a ramen place around here!

u9OsfUHkyu-KV1QE3c2kEw.text: I came to this place at Tuesday afternoon. I think it was at about 1 pm. Even though the place was packed and busy, the servers were very attentive and friendly. And the food came out really fast.  I tried the "spicy" Black Garlic Ramen. I was surprised. Really. Spicy and garlic taste at the same time. The noodles are chewy and the garlics are crispy. All the ingredients in the bowl were very well balanced.   I only tried the black garlic ramen, but it was amazing. I dont know about other ramens, so I will definitely come again and try other ramens. I took their togo menu, the tomato seafood ramen looks delicious! And I also sneaked a look at other tables, the appetizers look yummy too :)   Thank you Phoenix for the good service!

rOWBORYVG3gGXWUJlnZO7Q.text: The food is great, service is friendly and the atmosphere is nice.  This is always my go to ramen joint.

cX4Sq4qFoeovf0mmNtxYWA.text: Only the best! Fast service and yummy food! The location is small and sometimes the wait is long. We keep going back for the ramen and sushi. Such good food. I love that they give you a pitcher of water at the table since I'm a big water drinker.   Thank you, Ichi Ramen!

NrLY2_8JIVjf1N7DwsVqxw.text: This restaurant is pretty good. We've been here a number of times and the food has always been pretty good and the wait times have never been ridiculous and I think the prices are fair. If there's one thing about this place that keeps it from getting to 4 stars, it's the service.   Let's start with the wins: the food here is consistently good. Not amazing, but good all the time. I usually get the tonkatsu or black garlic ramen and both are great. I don't know how they get the broth to be as good as it is, but it's better than other places I've had ramen. And the pork in the broth --- it's delicious. I wish they made sandwiches with that pork. And like I said before, I think the prices are fair. During our last dinner there, we spent $35 (including tip) for two people.   My only hesitation about coming to this place is sometimes we've come here and the service has been 10/10. Other times I've come here and the service has been 6/10. During our last visit, for example, we had to wait a little longer to get refills on our drinks than I would've liked. And when it came time to get the bill, that also took a little longer. Nothing to really complain about, but enough that I think this is an opportunity for improvement.   Will I return here? For sure. Food is good and it does not break the bank and service is A-OK. Three stars all the way.

rWOigbvk5WnCh533p8JIDQ.text: First time in and really enjoyed it. It's a small place, row of booths to the right and tables on the left as you walk in. Nice and dark inside as well, cool on a hot day. We had been to Sapporo revolving sushi and had the ramen there so had an idea what we were in for but we were surprised at how good the ramen was here. Since it was our first time we did a little tasting to try a bit of everything. First we ordered the tempura basket which has 5 veggies and 3 shrimp (5.95) It was cooked really well and had the standard fare, onion, sweet potato, carrot, zucchini, etc. Next I ordered the shishito peppers (3.95) but was told they were out of them. We ordered the crispy rice tuna (6.95) and the fried rice (4.95). The crispy rice tuna was excellent. Cooked perfectly and the sauce was yummy. The fried rice was enough for two with some left over. Very tasty and fresh. So much better than the typical stuff you get at a Chinese restaurant.   For ramen I had the black garlic (8.95) with added butter and corn (.75 each) and my wife got the miso ramen (8.95). Both were excellent. I usually get a bowl of the black garlic ramen at sopporo but this was much better. The noodles were fresh and it was really good. Wife loved the miso as well.    Service was quick even though place was jammed. Loved it and will be back.

1r99aq1F65a_HADwrJctAw.text: Even though Las Vegas is completely oversaturated with ramen shops, this place still manages to stand out. I cant speak for the entire menu, but the Black Garlic ramen is very good. Pair that with some beer and maybe the crispy rice with tuna and you have a great meal.   The place is a bit small however, so expect a wait at the later parts of the night. And service can sometimes be lacking. However, if you are in the area, stop by and you might be pleasantly surprised. Obviously not the greatest but pretty good overall.

sRksRYovRb3-OyY037eJKQ.text: The classic tonkatsu is my fave. It's always consistent with the taste and the noodles are great. The chashu portion has gotten smaller since they've opened. I love the popcorn shrimp as I always order it. Comes with mixed greens in a miso dressing. Just the right amount of tart.

With the weather cooling off, this ramen house should be your FIRST thought for comfort, delicious and fast lunch or dinner. What I really mean is if you have it for lunch, you're going to want it again for dinner. Fantastic all the way around!

H47g-d15kpJTBxnNFxd6aw.text: I've came here once before but my husband and I came in today for lunch. There wasn't a wait this time, there usually is because seating is limited. We were greeted promptly, there wasn't too much interaction between us and the server but she was kind. The menu seems a bit limited but I didn't order ramen so maybe that's why. I got the signature ichi roll (very good) and popcorn shrimp which was very crunchy with a creamy sauce on top. My husband ordered the fried stuffed jalapeno and shrimp fried rice which was pretty crunchy but not bad. All of our food was $25 and they do military discount. It's decorated nicely inside and clean. I didn't like how straws are automatically given as well as ginger and wasabi- it's all very wasteful in my opinion. Overall not a bad spot for a lunch date but not good for a romantic date because it's pretty loud.

f_2nFS4vdXIv5Dy1OQbPlQ.text: My 11 year old daughter and I love this place! The food is always fresh and the staff are all friendly and professional...we usually frequent ichi at least once per week...we brought my granddaughter here last night for her first time and she is already asking when we can return. With only about 10 tables, you may have to wait a bit, but it's worth it!

PPI6bCapxvytrG8wjTSIKg.text: That was quick.  Located across the Walmart plaza, my wife and I have been eyeing Ichi since it opened. It's soup weather today, so we finally made it, after how many years lol.  It's small. 5 booths and 3 tables and a wall bar. So comfortably they can seat about 52 people. With that said, we had about a 10 to 15 minute wait from when we walked in. When seated we we're handed our menus and left with 2 glasses of water and a pitcher. Uh oh, I sense laziness. Despite having to already wait for a table, we had another 10 min wait to order. No intro, is this your first time, have you tried ramen before, or invitation to try anything special on their menu. In fact no customer service at all. "Are you ready to order?" Was the extent of their courtesy.   What ordered: Creamy Tonkotsu ramen Black Garlic Ramen Takoyaki  Despite the long wait to sit and order, soup came out quick. I went with a safe soup today just to get a feel of how they do their layers, and the Creamy Tonkotsu was a safe choice. Minus the corn, this dish was made pretty good. Shy on thier chasu compared to other Ramen places, but the broth was rich. Maybe a little too rich and the butter was a bit much. Otherwise tasty. On the other hand, the Black Garlic was way overwhelming for me. Take in consideration, I said for me. My wife, a garlic lover, says it was alright. Like the Creamy Tonkotsu, shy on the meat, but rich in roasted garlic flavor.   All in all, it's an ok spot. We'll have to make more trips here to sample through the menu. Why the 2 stars? Customer service is lacking. Some work in that department can help. The price we paid for the ramen could have been used at KBB.  Take your chance, your experience may be different. Just not our flavor.

6itpsj-6z8UiJBKBO1HFBw.text: Our family members brought us here for lunch after a fun day on Mt Charleston.   I've eaten at quite a few of ramen places and this place is by far my favorite one!!!!  I ordered the Black Garlic Ramen combo with gyoza (the combo also included a tiny bowl of toss salad). My husband got the Curry Ramen. My kids got the Shoyu and Miso ramen.   Oh...Em...Gee!!! The broths of all the ramens were so tasty!!! It wasn't bland and oily tasting like some other places are. The ramens came with the standard of bean sprouts, pork, bamboo shoots, hard boiled egg and green onions.   The portions are just enough!  I never had a chance to try the gyoza cause my kids whacked them all before I was able to eat any. I guess, you snooze, you lose right!   I would definitely recommend this place and we would definitely be going back!!!

Just gonna review what I ate: GYOZA- the flavor was good, They could've cooked it a bit longer mine was too soft.  MIZO RAMEN- This was good, the flavor was on point and I really enjoyed all of the ingredients.   OVERALL- I enjoyed the experience, the staff was good the food was ok, and it really hit the spot for a quick ramen stop on a late date nite.   Keep up the good work Ichi Ramen!

My husband had the garlic ramen and I had the miso ramen. Both were really good. Nice and hot which I like. The portions were very small compared to other ramen places we've been to. They do have an option for extra broth which is $2 more and another option for extra noodles which is also another $2. So an extra $4 if you want more I guess. That would make it about a $12 Bowl and that's not including other add ons you might want. Seems kind of pricy for the amount you get, but it was tasty. We ate every last drop of our bowls cause they were so small & We left hungry Maybe make the portions just a little bit more larger or even have a option for a small, medium or large bowl and or make the add ons a little more cheaper. We would come back. Hopefully the portions will be bigger by that time

Chashu tasted bland, and its texture was a bit firm compared to what you get at, say, Monta.  Gyoza was just OK.  Grade D for seating comfort:  we sat in a booth and found the seat to be unusually uncomfortable.  Perhaps it's too deep.  Maybe the counter chairs are more comfortable.  We wanted to eat fast and get up.  Maybe it's intended to be somewhat uncomfortable to speed up turnover.  The restaurant was packed on a Tuesday night around 5:30.  I suppose that's a good sign.
